Mission/Goals: The summer camp focuses on exposing the youth to the many options that they will have once they graduate high school.  They are exposed to colleges, trades and varies careers. They build new relations with their peer group(s) but also with the mentors that can help guide them down the path in which they are seeking to go.  A typical day starts with a team building exercise.  Each day consisits of a site visit, lunch (restaurant, fast food, etc.) and an afternoon activity (Zoo, State Museum, etc.). They young men and women discuss topics around gang vioience, bullying, financial literacy, GED vs. High School diploma, respect and making good choices, to name a few.  Every other Friday, a guest speaker is invited to speak to the group on a particular subject.  We also take part in Fitness Friday. (activity/exerciese).

Summer Advantage is one of only two summer learning models in the nation that has been scientifically proven to improve student outcomes. Our model was evaluated in an independent evaluation by the Urban Institute using random assignment, the gold standard of evaluation methods. Elements of our model include standards-based instruction in literacy and math in the morning; afternoon enrichment ranging from STEM to art and sports; a healthy breakfast and lunch; and Mentor Fridays that consist of guest speakers, workplace tours, field trips, college campus visits and scholar-led community service projects. Students who attend our program not only gain over 2 months of academic skills; in the following year they also perform better in their classes and on standardized tests. By improving their academic skills and learning about college, careers and the value of giving back, our scholars expand their aspirations for the future.

Anderson Woods was founded in 1978, and is a private, not-for-profit corporation chartered to provide summer camp experiences, as well as other services, for children and adults with physical and mental disabilities. The founders of Anderson Woods, Judy and David Colby, shared a vision of providing an experience that would foster self-esteem and empower these Special Ones to fulfill the potential within. From 3 campers sleeping in tents the first summer, our camp which spans 175 acres in rural Southern Indiana, now welcomes hundreds of campers of all ages and disabilities who sleep in four cabins each summer. Our aim is to provide self-confidence, dignity, and choices to persons with disabilities who, too often, are given none. It is with much humility and hope that we walk forward to serve these Special Ones.
